text:
The Karnataka High Court on Friday asked a petitioner, who filed a public interest litigation petition seeking directions to authorities to evolve alternative ways to minimise air pollution in the city, to come out with suggestions to reduce the pollution.

A Division Bench comprising Chief Justice Subhro Kamal Mukherjee and Justice Ravi Malimath told the counsel for the petitioner that the suggestion for reducing pollution has to be practical.

The petitioner, V. Shashaidhar, an RTI activist, sought direction to the State to come out with methods to minimise air pollution in terms of the WHO standards. The petitioner also requested the court to restrict entry of heavy commercial/transport/goods vehicles inside the city limits and for halting registration of diesel non-transport vehicles above 2000 CC.
title: HC tells litigant to suggest ways to reduce air pollution
